Tax Forms Guide

Understanding U.S. tax forms as an F-1 student - Interactive Guide

Key Takeaway

Every F-1 student must file Form 8843. If you earned any money, you must also file a Form 1040-NR (federal) and likely a state tax return.

Form W-2: Wage and Tax Statement

Form You Receive

Form 1042-S: Foreign Person's U.S. Source IncomeImportant

Form You Receive

Form 1098-T: Tuition StatementImportant

Form You Receive

Form 1099 Series

Form You Receive

Quick Reference Table

Form NameCategoryWhat It IsYour Action
W-4You Fill OutTells your employer how much tax to withhold from your paycheckGive to your employer when you start a job
W-2You ReceiveReports your total wages and taxes withheld from an employerUse for federal and state tax returns
1042-SYou ReceiveReports scholarship income or wages exempt under a tax treatyUse for Form 1040-NR
8843You FileDeclares you as an "exempt individual" from the Substantial Presence TestMail to IRS by deadline (mandatory)
1040-NRYou FileThe main U.S. federal income tax return for nonresidentsFile with IRS if you had U.S. income
